results.title: Man the killer, man the keeper (D)
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
First in a series of four films on the history and wildlife of Macquarie Island, 1,700 km South of Australia. The film shows man’s massive slaughter of the island’s seals and penguins for oil; the return after elimination 150 years ago of the New Zealand fur seal; stills and historical footage of the rape of the island’s resources, and a look at how the wildlife there is now being studied by the Antarctic division of the Australian Department of Science. Narrated by Sir Edmund Hillary. WARNING: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING SCENES
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Parer, Australia. Antarctic Division and ABC

results.title: A Very sheepish affair
results.creator_credit: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Anroste Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 37 of Series “Dodo, the kid from outer space”
Professor Fingers has invented a new sheep shearing machine that gives a really close shave. Unfortunately he tests it in the middle of zero degrees temperatures and the sheep are suffering. Dodo steps in to help the Professor make amends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Anroste Films

results.title: DoDo helps Interpol
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps Interpol catch card cheats on an ocean liner. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Secret of the pyramid
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 44 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo and his trusty computer bird friend Compy visit Egypt to help out the Professor. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Professor Finger builds a bridge
results.creator_credit: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
Dodo and the bird come to the rescue of the Professor when his new inventions of a plastic bridge over a ravine cannot take the stress. The remains of the bridge become a ferry instead.

results.title: Dodo's arrival story
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 41 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode the whole gang have a party to celebrate DoDo’s first anniversary on Earth, but, when DoDo is asked to recall how he came to Earth, his account provokes a conflict of memories. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Discovering psychology
results.creator_credit: David Espar, Tuggelin Yourgrau and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: A challenging series of programs on human psychology hosted by veteran psychology professor, Philip Zimbardo of Stanford University. New developments are measured against historical breakthroughs and theories are tested by the recent findings of leading researchers.

results.title: The Dolphin's gift
results.creator_credit: Kim Kindersley, Victoria Zr. Cotton and Zari Productions
results.brief_description: Narrated by John Hurt, this beautifully photographed program introduces Fungi, a bottle-nosed dolphin who lives at the mouth of Dingle Harbour, County Kerry in south west Ireland. Fungi has been charming local people and visitors to County Kerry for six years, though why he came to the harbour is a mystery to locals and experts alike. We are introduced to local inhabitants who share their thoughts and feelings about Fungi and the precarious nature of the survival of dolphin’s around the globe.
